data.text:
Main News Republic

Republic

MINSK, June 8 (BelTA) â Belarus will remain intent on stepping up the European vector of cooperation, said President of Belarus Alexander Lukashenko as he met with Minister of Foreign Affairs of Slovenia Samuel Zbogar on June 8. âYou can rest assured that all the developments in relations with our western partner, the European Union, is not an exceptional step on our part, not some game, it is the pursuance of our long-time strategic policy,â stressed Alexander Lukashenko. He...

MINSK, June 5 (BelTA) â As from July 1, 2009 Belarus will be granted the status of observer in the Council of the Baltic Sea States (CBSS). The relevant decision was made unanimously by the 15th session of the CBSS Ministerial Council in Dutch Elsinore, BelTA learnt from representatives of the Belarusian Foreign Ministry. At the session Ambassador of Belarus to Sweden Andrei Grinkevich voiced an address by Foreign Minister of Belarus Sergei Martynov. The address expressed gratitude for...

MINSK, June 3 (BelTA) â Over 130 companies and organisations have displayed their products at the 5th National Exhibition of Belarus in Kazakhstan BelarusEXPO 2009. The exposition takes place in Astana on June 3-6, BelTA learnt from the organizing committee. The exposition will display a wide range of Belarusian industrial and consumer goods. Large expositions will be featured by the Agriculture and Food, Education, Architecture and Construction Ministries, Belneftekhim, Bellegprom and...

MINSK, June 2 (BelTA) â The international specialized exhibition Power engineering. Ecology. Energy-saving. Electro 2009 will be held in Minsk on October 13-16. The relevant directive has been signed by Belarusian Premier Sergei Sidorsky, BelTA learnt from the Office of the Council of Ministers. The organizational committee of the forum is led by Belarusian Energy Minister Alexander Ozerets. The committee is composed of representatives of the Ministry of Natural Resources and...

MINSK, June 1 (BelTA) â The Republic of Belarus and the Kingdom of Spain signed an intergovernmental agreement on the recuperation of underage Belarusians in Spain on June 1, BelTA has learnt. The document was signed by Director of the Department for Humanitarian Activities of the Belarus President Property Management Directorate Alexander Kolyada and Counselor of the Embassy of Spain in Russia and Belarus (concurrent accreditation) Jesus Atienza Serna. According to Alexander Kolyada,...

MINSK, May 27 (BelTA) â The prerequisites are in place for the economic growth in Belarus, Vice-Premier of Belarus Andrei Kobyakov told reporters on May 27. Owing to the efforts of the government, we can see the signs of stability and prerequisites for the economic growth, Andrei Kobyakov said. According to him, in January-April Belarusâ GDP increased by 1.2%. âThis is a turning point. We have passed it and should add up now,â he said. The country has been implementing a package...

SHKLOV REGION, May 22 (BelTA) â Development of rural tourism and hotel business will help revive rural regions, President of Belarus Alexander Lukashenko told reporters. âWe can assert today that rural tourism in Belarus is a reality. The first stage of formation is over,â the head of state said. Belagroprombank makes a great contribution to the development of rural tourism by providing soft loans to constructive initiatives in this area, Alexander Lukashenko said. The President...

MINSK, May 20 (BelTA) â Over 40 companies are partaking in the 1st International Specialized Exhibition Real Estate and Investments 2009, Viktor Shanyukevich, chairman of the permanent commission for construction, housing, land tenure and ecology of the Minsk Council of Deputies, said at an opening ceremony of the exhibition in Minsk on May 20. The exhibition has showed a good start, Viktor Shanyukevich considers. The number of the participants would considerably increase in the ensuing...

MINSK, May 19 (BelTA) â Products of the defence sector of the Belarusian economy are internationally competitive, Prime Minister of Belarus Sergei Sidorsky said when opening MILEX-2009 in Minsk. The exhibition presents the armaments, military and special-purpose machines based on the latest information and telecommunication technologies including automation equipment, radio communications system, radar and aerospace equipment, precision weapons information support and others.
